name: taskqueue
title: TaskQueue API
description: Lets you access a Google App Engine Pull Task Queue over REST.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

enqueueTimestamp.description: Time (in seconds since the epoch) at which the task was enqueued.

kind.description: The kind of object returned, in this case set to task.

leaseTimestamp.description: Time (in seconds since the epoch) at which the task lease will expire. This value is 0 if the task isnt currently leased out to a worker.

payloadBase64.description: A bag of bytes which is the task payload. The payload on the JSON side is always Base64 encoded.

queueName.description: Name of the queue that the task is in.

retry_count.description: The number of leases applied to this task.

tag.description: Tag for the task, could be used later to lease tasks grouped by a specific tag.

acl.description: ACLs that are applicable to this TaskQueue object.

adminEmails.description: Email addresses of users who are "admins" of the TaskQueue. This means they can control the queue, eg set ACLs for the queue.

consumerEmails.description: Email addresses of users who can "consume" tasks from the TaskQueue. This means they can Dequeue and Delete tasks from the queue.

producerEmails.description: Email addresses of users who can "produce" tasks into the TaskQueue. This means they can Insert tasks into the queue.

kind.description: The kind of REST object returned, in this case taskqueue.

maxLeases.description: The number of times we should lease out tasks before giving up on them. If unset we lease them out forever until a worker deletes the task.

stats.description: Statistics for the TaskQueue object in question.

leasedLastHour.description: Number of tasks leased in the last hour.

leasedLastMinute.description: Number of tasks leased in the last minute.

oldestTask.description: The timestamp (in seconds since the epoch) of the oldest unfinished task.

totalTasks.description: Number of tasks in the queue.

items.description: The actual list of tasks returned as a result of the lease operation.

kind.description: The kind of object returned, a list of tasks.

items.description: The actual list of tasks currently active in the TaskQueue.

kind.description: The kind of object returned, a list of tasks.

get.description: Get detailed information about a TaskQueue.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

taskqueue.description: The id of the taskqueue to get the properties of.

delete.description: Delete a task from a TaskQueue.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

task.description: The id of the task to delete.

taskqueue.description: The taskqueue to delete a task from.

get.description: Get a particular task from a TaskQueue.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

task.description: The task to get properties of.

taskqueue.description: The taskqueue in which the task belongs.

insert.description: Insert a new task in a TaskQueue

project.description: The project under which the queue lies

taskqueue.description: The taskqueue to insert the task into

lease.description: Lease 1 or more tasks from a TaskQueue.

groupByTag.description: When true, all returned tasks will have the same tag

numTasks.description: The number of tasks to lease.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

tag.description: The tag allowed for tasks in the response. Must only be specified if group_by_tag is true. If group_by_tag is true and tag is not specified the tag will be that of the oldest task by eta, i.e. the first available tag

taskqueue.description: The taskqueue to lease a task from.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

taskqueue.description: The id of the taskqueue to list tasks from.

patch.description: Update tasks that are leased out of a TaskQueue. This method supports patch semantics.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.

update.description: Update tasks that are leased out of a TaskQueue.

project.description: The project under which the queue lies.
